legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: Calling the #novelcoronavirus the "Chinese virus" DOES NOT help contain the spread of the highly contagious disease. Do as China has been aggressively & effectively doing to combat the outbreak is the right option.

If a blame game ever helped kill the #coronavirus, let's play it even harder. But with the lives of people hanging in the balance, we just couldn't afford being distracted by war of words. We need to fight the uphill battle by supporting each other ammunition.

legacy.name: China Daily

legacy.full_text: Welcome! Fu Wa, a 17-year-old #panda at the Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding in Sichuan province, gave birth to twin male pandas on Tuesday. It is rare for pandas to give birth in the spring, base researcher Wu Kongju said. https://t.co/eJHRY9eOqR
Twin cubs, Double happiness

legacy.full_text:
"The real antidote to epidemic is not segregation, but rather cooperation." "... people should realize about such epidemics, is that the spread of the epidemic in any country endangers the entire human species. " Thanks for great analysis.@harari_yuval  
https://t.co/I3xkdmjN2J

legacy.full_text: The death of Giorgio #Valoti, the 70-year-old mayor of Cene, #Italy from #COVID19 Friday was widely reported in Chinese media, which praise his devotion to fighting #coronavirus. Chinese people know the cost & respect those giving service & sacrifice on duty. Stay strong, #Europe

legacy.full_text: There are major moves from countries to blunt the economic impact of the #coronavirus outbreak. What is lack is coordinated intl response, so @kaushikcbasu proposed a task force of 20 economists & experts to coordinate actions. https://t.co/f861QEGAEx

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: The IMF is making available $50 billion to help low income and emerging market countries to address #coronavirus outbreak, $10 billion of which is available at zero interest for the poorest members, IMF chief @KGeorgieva said at a press conference on Wednesday. @IMFNews https://t.co/WLx0dT7ASF

image_value.alt: Chonnam National University staff wearing protective attire are on standby for special transportation for Chinese students studying at their university, at Incheon International Airport in Incheon, South Korea, Tuesday, Feb. 25, 2020. Chinese students of the university are to arrive from China after their holiday. China and South Korea on Tuesday reported more cases of a new viral illness that has been concentrated...

value.string_value: China's massive travel restrictions, house-to-house checks, huge isolation wards and lockdowns of entire cities bought the world valuable time to prepare for the global spread of the new virus.

legacy.description: Advancing the power of facts, globally 🌎
legacy.name: The Associated Press

legacy.full_text: China’s massive efforts to contain  #CoronavirusOutbreak, including lock-downs of entire cities, bought the world valuable time to prepare for the global spread of the virus. The efforts will have best results if the world use that time wisely.  https://t.co/9jpFe1eSkF

legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: 2 million masks are flying to China today. Masks are difficult to buy because of high demand, but George H. W. Bush Foundation for US-China Relations has identified a reliable source through its US-China #Coronavirus Action Network (US-China CAN). Thank you all for generous help.

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: Headline matters. If you compare the news agencies' headlines, you'll find how some have stuck to "China virus" to refer to #coronavirus. To call a virus that knows no border this way, even for convenience, is a blatant bias & against the WHO naming convention! @Reuters @AP @AFP https://t.co/d34HA2ukLi

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

value.string_value: US will spend $100 million to help China, others fight coronavirus

legacy.description: Read China, daily on your smartphone.
legacy.name: China Daily app

legacy.full_text: Anti-#coronavirus efforts get another boost: The US @StateDept said Friday it stands ready to spend up to $100 million to assist China & other countries affected by the epidemic. "We encourage the rest of the world to match our commitment," it said. https://t.co/tH3ScQ2AQK

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: President Trump loved what he saw on The Washington Post: 'Trump Acquitted', on Thursday, the day after the Senate acquitted him of impeachment charges. “It’s the only good headline I’ve ever had in the Washington Post,” he said. Joke or not, newspapers do play their roles! https://t.co/sJIfomPjxh

legacy.full_text:
This is a great message of solidarity from @katyperry to the people of #China. I couldn't agree more - we're in this together and we can only stop it together! Thank you for lending your voice to such an important cause. #2019nCoV 

🎥 @SinaWeibo, Katy Perry https://t.co/u7wnn5xPdc
Thank you @katyperry

legacy.full_text:
A good read. Highlights of a report by @dlweniger: 
Restrictions just inconvenience for now
Keeping employee healthy
Being good neighbors in China
Tariff dispute didn't help
@Cargill  @3M
 https://t.co/DetiuHnCK3

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: The best way to keep #CoronavirusOutbreak out of the US is to support China's efforts to contain it, @USChinaBusiness President Craig Allen said. USCBC member @Cargill pledged $300,000 in relief aid while @3M donated respirators, surgical masks & hand sanitizer to China.

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: (Continued quotes from@USChamber president & CEO @ThomasJDonohue) The United States business community is prepared and already involved in helping the Chinese government deal with this problem. And these are the times when friends help each other. 2-2

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: I asked @USChamber president & CEO @ThomasJDonohue for his take on the fight against #coronavirus. “These are the times when friends help each other.” His words kept me warm this winter day. Full quotes: We’re all working very hard to assist the Chinese in every way we can. 2-1 https://t.co/U9ryfEJsO0

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: Additional progress in US-China trade negotiations that leads to a further reduction in trade policy uncertainty could lead to higher-than-expected US growth, @WorldBank said in a Jan 8 report. That' why the two should meet each other half way, defuse the tensions to benefit all. https://t.co/0rLTQwRFcj

legacy.description: Chief Washington Correspondent of China Daily;  Alfred Friendly Program Fellow at Denver Rocky Mountain News in 2001. RTs ≠ endorsements. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Huanxin Zhao

legacy.full_text: The @BertelsmannSt study said the multilateral trading order is in a deep, existential crisis. The most immediate threat is the US resisted confirming the nomination of judges to the @WTO Appellate Body, paralyzing the arbitration role of the WTO.  (2-2)
